How Do You Find A Good Accountant?

If you are going stir-crazy trying to find a good accountant in Hong Kong – perhaps you need to prepare your personal tax returns or your company forms you’ve likely wondered how best you can find a good certified public accountant (CPA) in the city.

One of the best places to find a good quality Accountant is through the Hong Kong Institute of Certified Public Accountants.

This resource lists a ton of excellent Accountants that will help you navigate your way through the maze of legal-tax requirements in Hong Kong.

List of Hong Kong Accountants

Accountants In Hong Kong

An accountant is someone who works in the field of accounting or accountancy.

Accountants who have passed their professional associations’ certification tests can use titles like:

  • Chartered Accountant
  • Chartered Certified Accountant
  • Certified Public Accountant
  • Registered Public Accountant

By legislation, such experts are given certain obligations, such as the capacity to certify an organization’s financial accounts, and they can be held accountable for professional misconduct. Non-qualified accountants can work for a qualified accountant or independently, but they have no statutory rights or duties.

An accountant might work for a company that needs accounting services on a regular basis or for an accounting business that offers accounting consulting services to other companies. The Big Four auditing firms employ the most accountants worldwide. The majority of accountants, on the other hand, work in trade, industry, and government.

The Hong Kong Accountancy Industry

The Hong Kong Institute of Certified Public Accountants (HKICPA) regulates the accounting profession in Hong Kong under the Professional Accountants Ordinance (Chapter 50, Laws of Hong Kong). The Corporations Ordinance (Chapter 32, Laws of Hong Kong) and other laws such as the Securities and Futures Ordinance, the Listing Rules, and others govern the auditing sector for limited companies.

In 2005, the HKICPA stopped recognizing oversharing organisations for accreditation purposes under the professional accountant’s ordinance. Except for CIPFA, all British RQBs were re-accredited in general. The most recent acknowledgment may be found at the HKICPA.

Chartered Certified Accountant (ACCA), Chartered Accountant (CA or ACA), Chartered Management Accountant (ACMA), and International Accountant have commonly recognized accounting qualifications in the Commonwealth of Nations, which includes the United Kingdom, Canada, Australia, New Zealand, Hong Kong pre-1997, and several other states (AAIA). Certified Public Accountant (CPA – Ireland and CPA – Hong Kong), Chartered Professional Accountant (CPA – Canada), Certified Management Accountant (CMA – Australia) (CMA – Sri Lanka), Certified Practising Accountant (CPA – Australia), and members of the Institute of Public Accountants (Australia), and Certified Public Practising Accountant (CPPA – New Zealand) are some of the other qualifications available in specific countries.

Been living in Hong Kong since 2015

Henry Dalziel

Boiler repair is the maintenance of boilers and their components. A boiler, also known as a heat exchanger, is a mechanical device that uses the pressure from hot water to transfer heat from one place to another. Boilers are used in homes and businesses to provide heating and hot water for everyday purposes such as cooking, bathing, and laundry.

Boiler repair is the process of repairing or replacing a boiler, which may be damaged by accident, through improper use and/or neglect. Boilers are used to heat water, therefore they have high fuel consumption and produce emissions. Therefore it is important that they are properly maintained.

A Boiler malfunction occurs when the water in the boiler has reached boiling temperature and then begins to boil. Boiler boilers are used in many different industries, including power plants and factories. They provide heat to steam or hot water for industrial processes such as heating buildings, cooking food, making electricity, or producing hydrogen gas (as in electrolysis).

List of Hong Kong Boiler Repair Companies

Boiler Break

The Boiler Break is a system of cooling water in a boiler. The Boiler Break forces the hot water out of the boiler and into a heat exchanger where it is cooled down by air or other means. Most boilers have an automatic thermostat that turns off the steam when the temperature rises to about 80 degrees Fahrenheit (27°C). This lowers operating costs but can cause problems if there are no coolant pumps to remove excess heat from the system.

The Boiler Break provides this necessary service by directing heated water through valves and spigots on its way up to tank level. As soon as one valve opens, steam flows from that spigot into another cooler valve, which directs it back through both open and closed spigots before returning to tank level. In this manner, all but about half a pound of steam remains in each pipe at all times and never enters your condenser coils unless you want it to!

According to Hong Kong government transport laws and regulations, all privately owned vehicles over six years old are required (by law) to pass a Certificate of Roadworthiness Examination (COR) at one of the 150 designated Car Testing Centres.

Checks and tests that must be passed include:

  • Working Brakes
  • Intact Fuel System
  • Working Brake Lights
  • Effective Steering
  • Adequate Suspension
  • Non-worn Tyres and Wheels (with at least 5mm of tread left)
  • Legal Emissions

All passenger cars constructed six years or more ago must undergo the CTC test at a Designated Car Testing Centre, according to Hong Kong Government Transport Regulations (DCTC). Furthermore, as a condition of license renewal, all commercial vehicles must pass the CTC test every year after receiving a certificate of roadworthiness.

Most automobile repair shops in Hong Kong have Government DCTCs that provide this service for all passenger cars and light cargo trucks weighing up to 1.9 tons.

Typical Car Repair Issues

A damaged vehicle might cause a variety of problems. Here are some common automobile maintenance scenarios.

Coolant Repair

In approximately an hour, you can change your coolant. To eliminate air pockets from the cooling system as you fill, you’ll need to invest in an air-powered refilling tool. On your first coolant change, you’ll save approximately $50, and each subsequent one will save you about $100. However, we urge that you take your automobile to a mechanic.

Oil Filter Changes

We’ve all overtightened an oil filter to the point that it’s impossible to remove. If you believe you can get it out by twisting a long screwdriver through the can, you’re wrong. The screwdriver will just rip the container open, drenching you in oil. When you’re done dealing with that mess, the filter will still be stuck, which will annoy you even more. Use a band-type wrench coated with coarse-grit adhesive-backed sandpaper to remove a jammed filter.

Brake Repair

Brake fluid should be replaced every two years or 24,000 miles, according to several automakers. Others make no mention of it. However, testing your brake fluid is simple. Simply dip a test strip into the fluid and match the color to the chart provided on the package.

You can’t perform a total brake fluid flush on your own, but you can perform a fluid switch. This operation will not completely replace the old fluid with new, but it will provide enough new fluid to make a difference.

Transmission Fluid Repair

Change your gearbox fluid to extend the life of your engine. Using a specific transmission fluid pump makes it much easier, and doing it yourself saves you $100 in service charges. Again, we recommend seeking assistance from a reputable auto repair shop before proceeding.

Car AC Repair

When you turn on the fan on your automobile, does it merely blast chilly air? Recalibrating the heating system or replacing the actuator might be the solution. When your MAF (Mass Air Flow) sensor becomes dirty, it is recommended that you clean it rather than replace this $300 item. It’s quick and simple, but get expert assistance!

Flat Tire Repair

It is a necessary life skill to know how to repair a flat tire on an automobile. Flat tires generally occur with little or no notice and at the most inconvenient times. When it comes to automobile maintenance, this is a pretty prevalent problem. If your struts have accumulated 80,000 miles or more, they’re worn out and need to be replaced. We’re aware that they’re costly (HKD$700 for front struts changed at a shop). However, driving on worn struts will cost you more in the long term.

Damaged Hood

If your hood is difficult to lock and unlatch, it’s probably rusted and dry. Spray rust penetrant and spray lithium grease will solve the problem in approximately 10 minutes. Remove the hood and apply rust penetrant to the whole latch mechanism. Several times lock and unlatch the hood until the mechanism operates properly. You’ll need to add stronger lubrication because the rust penetrant won’t stay long. Open the hood and apply white lithium grease to all moving components. You’re fine to go if you latch and unlatch the hood a few more times. WD-40 often helps in this instance.

Car Electrical Problems

Electrical issues in automobiles may appear insurmountable, but they are not. All you have to do is figure out where the current runs out. In this case, you must seek expert assistance to repair your damaged vehicle.

Hong Kong’s Stance on CBD: A Comprehensive Overview

Cannabidiol (CBD) has seen a huge change in the legal landscape in Hong Kong, which is a city that is known for its fast-paced urban environment.

The classification of CBD on the same level as drugs like heroin and cocaine came into effect on February 1st 2023, signifying a shift toward a more rigorous approach to what was formerly a rapidly expanding industry for goods containing CBD.

The Legal Shift: CBD as a “Dangerous Drug”

The cannabinoid CBD, which comes from the cannabis plant, has been gaining popularity due to the medicinal benefits it supposedly possesses despite lacking the euphoric effects that are generally associated with marijuana. In spite of this, the authorities in Hong Kong have decided that it is now against the law to own, consume, or distribute CBD.

This step is in line with the city’s stringent drug rules, which remain in place despite a general movement toward the legalization of cannabis and things related to it worldwide.

Implications for Businesses and Consumers

The restriction has had direct ramifications for firms that had been capitalizing on the expanding CBD market by offering a variety of products, ranging from skincare to edibles.

These businesses had been offering items that included cannabidiol (CBD). Consumers who earlier experienced what they believed to be the benefits of CBD now face the challenge of navigating the legal consequences of possession, which may result in harsh penalties.

Regional Context: Asia’s Drug Policies

The prohibition of CBD in Hong Kong contributes to the generally stringent drug laws that are widespread throughout Asia. Despite the fact that certain nations, such as Thailand, have taken a progressive approach by legalizing cannabis products, including CBD, others, such as Singapore and China, continue to uphold a policy of zero tolerance.

This contrast draws attention to the various regulatory techniques that are utilized throughout the region.

Global Debate and Regulatory Challenges

The discussion that is taking place all over the world regarding CBD regulation is complicated and continuing. Even if the World Health Organization has not discovered any evidence that CBD on its own could cause harm or be abused, the fact that it is difficult to extract pure CBD without any traces of THC is still a cause for caution.

This issue is complex, as evidenced by the fact that some nations, such as the United States, have adopted restrictions that vary depending on the origin of CBD products as well as the amount of THC that they contain.

The Future of CBD in Hong Kong and Beyond

Because of recent legislation passed in Hong Kong, both the future of CBD regulation in the city and its influence on policies around the world are now unknown.

The question of how to strike a balance between the possible medicinal benefits of CBD and the necessity of regulatory control in order to manage hazards is still being discussed.

Drone Laws in Hong Kong

When it comes to drone legislation and regulations, Hong Kong is one of the more laid-back cities in the world. Drones were originally dubbed the “wild frontier.”

Drones must be flown in open regions away from busy areas and at least 50 meters away from persons, cars, and vessels. You obviously cannot fly near an airport or any other location where manned aircraft may be present (this includes Victoria Harbour, where there is often considerable helicopter traffic). Drones are also prohibited near vulnerable sites such as prisons, power plants or power lines, and Disneyland.

In Hong Kong, the current maximum height for drone flight is 300 feet (91 meters) above ground level.

While many drones today have a range of several kilometers, you must have your drone in a visual line of sight at all times in Hong Kong. In practice, this means you should be no more than 500 meters away.

Flying a drone is allowed in Hong Kong, according to the Hong Kong Civil Aviation Department (HKCAD), however, we urge that you are aware of and comply with the drone laws stated below before doing so.

Here are the most essential rules to know about operating a drone in Hong Kong, based on our study and interpretation of the legislation.

We are not international aviation attorneys, and while we attempt to maintain this website up to date for drone pilots, the fact is that drone rules in Hong Kong might change throughout the year, and such changes can be difficult to follow.

Only operational criteria, such as altitude and maximum flying distance, will apply to drones weighing less than 250 grams. Operators of drones weighing more than 7kg will be required to pay for in-depth training and qualification exams. Drones weighing more than 250 grams would require insurance, while drones weighing more than 7 kg would need to be approved by authorities and require insurance to safeguard against flying dangers.

Tourists can fly drones that weigh less than 7 kg recreationally, according to the Hong Kong Civil Aviation Department (CAD). Because Hong Kong is such a tiny and heavily populated city, drone operators must remain vigilant and adhere to strict restrictions.

If you carelessly or negligently cause or allow your drone to endanger another person or damage property in Hong Kong, you may face criminal charges. Other Hong Kong regulations need also to be followed, such as the Personal Data (Privacy) Ordinance. Using your drone to spy on someone, follow them without their permission, or peer through their windows might get you in trouble.

Drone Insurance

From June 1, 2022, drone operators in Hong Kong will be required to register their drones, complete training and pass exams, and purchase insurance. Anything weighing between 250 grams and 7 kilograms will be required to register under the proposed Small Unmanned Aircraft (SUA) Order.

Places Not To Fly Your Drone In Hong Kong

Yes, as long as you keep it close to the route and visible. No-fly zones can always be seen in your flight app.

On both the Kowloon and Hong Kong Island sides of the bay, I would urge you to avoid flying. There are several helipads in this region, with moderate aviation traffic during the day. The same may be said about crowded beaches. Many beaches also have helipads, which lifeguards will warn you against flying near.

Flying over special events, as enticing as it may be, might get you in trouble. In 2016, three drone operators were detained for flying above a Formula E race.

Apart from that, Hong Kong is a great place for drones. If this is your first time, practice at Nam Sang Wai. There is plenty of open areas without any buildings or people. Remember that 70% of Hong Kong is undeveloped. So get out of town and pick a good site.

Drone Night-Flying In Hong Kong

In Hong Kong, night flying is currently prohibited. A drone may only be used during daylight hours and in excellent weather. Strong winds should also be avoided when operating your drone. Check the specs of your drone to see what the maximum sustained wind speed is for safe operation.

Commercial Drone Flying In Hong Kong

You are required to submit an application to the Hong Kong Civil Aviation Department in order to get a permit for operating a drone for business purposes (CAD). In order to obtain a permit, you will be required to fill out a few forms, submit a flight plan that includes the date(s) you want to fly, and demonstrate that you are an experienced and competent pilot (which means demonstrating that you have completed some sort of pilot training or qualification), and show that you have adequate liability insurance coverage.

What is Functional Medicine?

Functional medicine is a type of complementary medicine that includes a variety of untested and unproven approaches and treatments. Its proponents say that it concentrates on the “root causes” of illnesses by developing “individualized treatment regimens” based on interactions between the environment and the gastrointestinal, endocrine, and immunological systems. It has been labeled as quackery, pseudoscience, and a rebranding of complementary and alternative medicine.

Functional medicine is a systems biology-based approach to discovering and treating a disease’s underlying causes. Each symptom or differential diagnosis might be one of several factors causing a person’s sickness.

Who Started Functional Medicine?

Jeffrey Bland invented functional medicine. Bland launched The Institute for Functional Medicine (IFM) as part of one of his firms, HealthComm, in the early 1990s. In 2001, the Institute for Functional Medicine (IFM), which promotes functional medicine, became a recognized non-profit. Mark Hyman is one of the most vocal supporters today.

The term “functional medicine” is used loosely by its proponents. According to oncologist David Gorski, the ambiguity is a deliberate strategy to make functional medicine difficult to question, but in general, its practice focuses on unneeded and expensive diagnostic procedures undertaken in the name of “holistic” health treatment.

Hong Kong Functional Medicine Clinics

The functional medicine concept arose from the ideas and viewpoints of a small number of significant thought leaders who recognized the value of a customized approach to disease etiology based on the latest discoveries in nutritional science, genomics, and epigenetics. These thought leaders figured out how to put these new discoveries to work in the clinic, addressing core causes with low-risk therapies that change molecular and cellular systems to reverse disease drivers.

Functional medicine thought leaders are able to use new knowledge in ways that typically resulted in remarkable improvements for patients who had previously failed therapies. A return to scientific ideas of developing new techniques to explore unifying variables at the cellular and system levels that underpin organism-wide issues as part of this advancement. Find Out More

Providers of functional medicine spend time listening to you and compiling your medical history. We utilize this information to figure out what’s causing your sicknesses, such as inadequate diet, stress, pollutants, allergies, genetics, and your microbiome (the bacteria living in and on your body).

The strategy stresses prevention and combines standard treatment with successful supplementary therapies from what is commonly referred to as “alternative” medicine. Proponents of Functional Medicine

Instead of accepting a disease model based on the notions of “antecedents,” “triggers,” and “mediators,” proponents of functional medicine criticize current medical knowledge and reject its paradigms. These are intended to correlate to the underlying reasons, direct causes, and specific aspects of a person’s sickness. From these characteristics, a functional medicine practitioner will create a “matrix” that will serve as the foundation for therapy.

Adrenal exhaustion and a variety of chemical imbalances are among the ailments that functional medicine practitioners claim to detect and cure, according to research studies. Despite the absence of proof or research to back up his claim, Joe Pizzorno, a prominent figure in functional medicine, claims that 25% of Americans are poisoned by heavy metals and require detoxification. Detox pills, according to scientists, are a waste of time and money.

Functional Medicine is a science-based, customized approach to health and wellness. Rather than focusing just on the symptoms, it seeks to discover and treat the underlying cause of the illness.

Practitioners use a patient-centered approach and are aware of the lifestyle, genetic, and environmental influences on a patient’s health. This allows practitioners to treat the individual as a whole, rather than merely a collection of symptoms.

A sickness might have numerous causes, and several illnesses can evolve as a result of a single cause. Treatment that targets the source of the problem might have a long-term effect on the body. Because Functional Medicine practitioners view the body as a whole rather than a collection of parts, therapeutic techniques address the entire body.

Keto Diet & Functional Medicine in Hong Kong

Diet, genetics, hormonal fluctuations, prescription, over-the-counter drugs, and other lifestyle factors are all taken into account. People with chronic diseases that are resistant to standard medical treatment may benefit from this sort of specialist.

To determine the fundamental reasons for disease, functional medicine specialists examine your whole medical history. They typically devote more time to you than traditional doctors. They gather extensive data on the condition as well as your overall lifestyle.

They then devise a treatment strategy to address a variety of variables that may be contributing to chronic illnesses. Prescription drugs, vitamins, and other therapy may be included.

Finally, they monitor therapy progress and make adjustments as required. Because each therapy is customized to that person’s specific ailment, the functional medicine method is unique for each person.

A functional medicine doctor’s connection with you may differ from that with your primary care physician. It’s a more collaborative collaboration, according to The Institute For Functional Medicine: the doctor considers your input while also holding you accountable for your decisions about your health and treatment.

The care delivered in functional medicine is based on the system affected, not the diagnosis. A diagnosis of depression, for example, might have several reasons. Each reason will be researched and treated by a functional medicine expert, resulting in a unique treatment plan.

Helicopter Tours in Hong Kong

Been living in Hong Kong since 2015

Henry Dalziel

I've been living and working in Hong Kong since 2016 as an SEO Professional.

Are you interested in taking a Helicopter Sightseeing Tour in Hong Kong?

If so – read on! We will get you airborne in no time at all.

Helicopter tours in Hong Kong will possibly leave you with amazing memories that will last a lifetime.

Hong Kong is one of the world’s most aesthetically stunning cities. It boasts the most skyscrapers of any city with a dense population.

Approximately 275 square kilometers are home to almost 7.2 million people. It is also one of the world’s greenest cities, with just 28% of its area (1,100 sq km) developed. It’s a metropolis made up of 263 islands, rolling mountains, and stunning beaches.

Best HK Helicopter Tour?

Of course, this is entirely a subjective question, but the best-known Helicopter operator is the Heliservices Helicopter Company.

The Heliservices Helicopter Company, based here in Hong Kong, founded in 1978, runs a fleet of high-end helicopters for scenic flights, VIP transports, and construction work and is one of the better-known Helicopter operators.

The Heliservices scenic flights take off from the top of the renowned Peninsula hotel and offer an unrivaled aerial perspective of the world-famous Victoria Harbour. The tour then flies over the famous Kowloon mountain range and can also include a cruise over Hong Kong Island’s beaches and bays.

The MD902 Explorer Twin-Engine Helicopter, which seats up to 6 passengers, is used for all of their trips. The plane is comfortable, quiet, and has superb visibility all around.

The pilots at Heliservices are among the best in the world, so if you are wondering whether Helicopter tours are safe – then fear not! Crew members get planned recurrent training and competency inspections from HKCAD-authorized Type Rating Examiners and Line Training Captains, ensuring that the highest safety requirements are met.

If you decide to use Heliservices as your tour operator then you will likely meet a representative at the Mandarin Hotel Clipper Lounge to listen to a safety briefing, fill out some paperwork, and prepare yourself for an unforgettable journey. You’ll have plenty of time to unwind and enjoy the fantastic lounge museum as well! The Clipper Lounge includes a private collection of vintage aviation artifacts and photographs, and it is definitely worth visiting early to properly appreciate this fascinating museum.

List of Hong Kong Helicopter Tour Companies

We’ve identified the following companies in Hong Kong that offer Helicopter tours.

Types of Helicopters

The majority of Hong Kong Helicopter operators operate twin-engined, air-conditioned MD902 Explorer helicopters, which are typically outfitted with six VIP seats, comfortable interiors, and a world-class music system, among other features.

When Do The Hong Kong Helicopter Tours Operate?

Helicopter excursions are available on specific days of the week, including Fridays, Saturdays, Sundays, and public holidays.

They operate all year round.

Hong Kong Helicopter Flight Duration

Most Hong Kong Helicopter tours will last under 30 minutes.

There are longer tours as well, but you’d need to pay more. The price is associated with the fuel burn rate.

The list of Helicopter tour companies mostly lasts 30 mins but a few of them also offer standard 45-minute trips.

The tour operators will allow bookings between 10:00 a.m. and 5:40 p.m. most days!

Where Do The Tours Go?

The tours will almost certainly include a flight around Hong Kong Island with a view of the famous Victoria Harbour Skyline and the beaches and the bays around the south island. The journey will take you around Hong Kong, where you will be able to see the harbor as well as the beaches and bays of South Hong Kong Island.

A typical helicopter itinerary would include:

  • Victoria Harbour
  • Hong Kong Island
  • Kowloon
  • Lantau Island’s Big Buddha

A 30-minute tour would include (for example) a fly-over of Kowloon’s lively scene and the stunning perspective of the gigantic lion rock! You may also see the beauty of the Tsing Ma Bridge and the bustling cargo port.

Experience the difference between Victoria Harbour’s vivacity and the serene serenity of Sai Kung, as well as the stunning, globally famous Hong Kong National Parks will leave you with life-long experiences.

Passengers should arrive at least 30 minutes before departure time for a safety briefing and to complete administrative paperwork.

Children

Any youngsters under the age of 12 must be accompanied by one adult (over the age of 18). For safety concerns, children under the age of two cannot be accommodated. On the helicopter, each person must have their own seat – that’s the law!

Disabilities

Wheelchair users have the ability to be included in the tour. Passengers can get help boarding and disembarking the helicopter from the crew.

Insurance

All tours ought to be completely covered, and their insurance coverage should be the same as that of any other major Hong Kong airline, including airlines like Cathay Pacific.

On request, the helicopter operator may provide you with further information – so if this is a concern we’d suggest you check with them.

If you are particularly nervous then you could look into Hong Kong life insurance, but the tour operator will likely have you covered, but as ever – do your due diligence!

Weather

Scenic flights are unable to fly in inclement weather due to safety considerations.

Helicopter services operate in compliance with the weather minima established by the Hong Kong government, and if your flight is cancelled as a consequence of bad weather, we will make every attempt to reschedule your reservation.

How Much Does A Helicopter Tour Cost In Hong Kong?

It depends on three things:

  • Flight (tour) duration
  • The number of passengers
  • Whether it is a shared trip or a private charter

Hong Kong based tour operators use helicopters that can comfortably fit between four and six passengers.

Subject to availability, reservations can be made up to one week in advance.

Advance Reservations Only morning (AM) or afternoon (PM) departures are available for reservations made more than one month in advance.

One week before the experience day, the specific date, time, and location of the flight will be verified.

What About Cancellations? Some operators in Hong Kong require a minimum of four passengers before the Helicopter is allowed to take off. The flight might be canceled if there are insufficient people on your preferred date – so be sure to check if the operator has this strict rule.

If you share your Helicopter booking and the other couple (or passengers) fail to show then you might have your trip rescheduled for a mutually convenient date.

A typical Hong Kong helicopter tour will cost anywhere between HKD 9,000 to 16,000 for 30 minutes (per couple).

Best Time To Do A Helicopter Tour?

A number of factors will influence the ‘optimal’ time to visit Hong Kong. The weather will, of course, be the most important element. Here’s a very rough guide:

December to February: the weather is mild and ideal for trekking and would be ideal for a helicopter tour. There was little rain and plenty of sunshine for two-thirds of the days.

March to May: can be unpredictable weather, with some sun and some clouds, and high humidity. During the spring, rain might fall on a regular basis.

June to August: In Hong Kong, this is not the best time to go hiking, but would be perfect for a helicopter trip. Humidity is at its peak, temperatures can approach 30 degrees on a regular basis, and rainstorms are common.

September to November: the greatest season to visit Hong Kong is from September to November. You get pleasant sunshine, but the humidity level is at its lowest for the year. During these months, rainfall is also scarce.

Summary

There’s no better way to see Hong Kong than from above.

Take a thrilling helicopter trip away from the crowds for a breathtaking view of Victoria Harbour and the Hong Kong skyline!

The experience of soaring over Hong Kong’s iconic skyscrapers and across Victoria Harbour, where you’ll get a bird’s-eye view of the city’s pulsing heart will be an experience you’ll never forget.

Take in Hong Kong’s most renowned sights, including the ICC, IFC, The Peak, Star Ferry Pier, and the new cruise terminal at the old Kai Tak airport, as well as picturesque jewels on the island’s south side, such as Aberdeen Harbour and Tai Tam Country Park.

If the weather permits, take in the stunning views of the cityscape throbbing beneath you, including sights of the Outlying Islands, the busy container terminal, Tsing Ma Bridge, and much more.

Hong Kong BNO Process

The UK opened a unique immigration path for British National (Overseas) (BN(O)) status holders and their family members on January 31, 2021. The path represents the United Kingdom’s historic and moral commitment to Hong Kong residents who opted to maintain their links to the United Kingdom by applying for BN(O) status prior to Hong Kong’s transfer to China in 1997.

On a road to citizenship, persons with BN(O) status and their qualifying family members can seek to come to the UK to live, study, and work in nearly any capacity. BN(O) status holders and their family members will be allowed to apply for settlement after five years in the UK, followed by citizenship after another twelve months.

After Hong Kong was handed over to China in 1997, BN(O) status was created for Hong Kong residents so that they may maintain links to the UK. Registration for BN(O) status was a limited-time offer, and there are no plans to reopen it or provide retrospective applications. Children cannot inherit BN(O) status, and only individuals having BN(O) status are eligible to apply for a BN(O) passport.

The British Nationals Overseas visa (BNO visa) permits Hong Kong residents to live, work, and study in the United Kingdom. The British National (Overseas) visa, or BNO visa, for Hong Kong nationals, was introduced on January 31, 2021, as a means of supporting people who have been negatively affected by Hong Kong’s new national security regulations.

Hong Kong applicants must provide a TB test certificate with their initial applications. Appendix T of the Immigration Rules contains more information on TB testing requirements.

Even when you stop being dependent on your BNO sponsor, your visa remains valid until the expiration date mentioned on the visa. After your BNO visa expires, you do not require your sponsor or to be reliant on him or her to apply for indefinite leave to remain in the UK.

Only people with BNO status are eligible to apply for a BNO passport. You will not be allowed to apply for a BNO passport if you were given a BNO visa as a dependant and do not have BNO status. A BNO visa does not offer you any additional privileges.

Hong Kong Law Firms

Of course, selecting companies that we decide are going to be the “Best Hong Kong Law Firms” would be entirely subjective because there are so many different variables.

However – thank you for taking a look at our list and we hope that it brings you some value.

Lawyers ought to be well-versed in many different facets of Hong Kong law as a local independent legal firm. They ought to be able to assist you with a variety of legal issues, including intellectual property, Hong Kong family law, criminal law, immigration, and more.

Navigating the legal landscape is difficult, whether that involves compliance work, litigation, or anything else.

Hong Kong Law Society

The Law Society of Hong Kong is a professional society for Hong Kong solicitors with legislative powers to govern solicitors, trainee solicitors, and foreign attorneys’ professional behavior. It was founded in 1907 as a limited-by-guarantee corporation.

The Law Society is devoted to providing relevant and effective assistance to our members, including professional training and legal practice updates, and speaks for the solicitors’ profession in Hong Kong. The Law Society is dedicated to assisting our members in achieving and maintaining the highest professional standards in the public interest.

The Law Society strives to raise general public legal awareness, facilitate public access to legal services, and promote a culture of giving back to the community among our members by reaching out and maintaining a wide local and global network for knowledge exchange, experience sharing, and collaboration between our members and different sectors of both the local and international communities.

Lawyers in Hong Kong

The Law List is issued by the Law Society to assist the public and Law Society members in identifying and locating solicitors, overseas attorneys, and law firms that have registered with the Law Society. The Law List’s personal information should not be utilized for any other purpose. Using personal data from The Law List for direct marketing without the agreement of the data subjects is illegal under the Personal Data (Privacy) Ordinance.

The Law Society takes no responsibility for any errors or omissions in The Law List, although taking all reasonable measures to guarantee its correctness.

List of the Best Hong Kong Law Firms

Employment Hong Kong Lawyers

Hong Kong employment attorneys deal with a wide variety of employment law problems and frequently represent both employers and employees.

Fraud Hong Kong Lawyers

Lawyers that specialize in fraud and asset tracking frequently provide guidance on local and international conflicts that are the result of commercial fraud, asset theft, and other types of corporate crimes.

Family & Divorce Hong Kong Lawyers

Family and divorce attorneys combine their specialized expertise with first-rate client care and practical solutions to help clients get through the challenging period that they are going through.

Hong Kong Legal Arbitrage

It is beneficial to seek arbitration from a law firm that has an experienced and multilingual legal staff that can advise on Hong Kong legal issues (and China-related matters). Arbitration lawyers should have a lot of expertise with domestic and international arbitrations involving a wide range of economic problems. Insolvency litigators in Hong Kong often handle high-profile insolvencies and company failures.

Mediation is becoming increasingly popular as a time and cost-effective means of resolving conflicts. Always look for lawyers that have extensive mediation expertise in a variety of cases.

How to Find a Good Lawyer in Hong Kong?

If your legal case is complicated or involves a large sum of money, you should consult a lawyer before proceeding. After all, attorneys do more than just provide legal advice. They provide strategic guidance and use advanced technological abilities to solve legal issues. You should look for a knowledgeable and experienced lawyer to help you through the difficult legal system.

It’s not always simple to find a skilled lawyer who can effectively assist you with your specific issue. Expect to locate a reputable lawyer by merely reading an advertisement or searching for a lawyer in your area online. There isn’t enough information in these sources to make an informed decision.

A better method is to communicate with others in your community who have dealt with the same issue you are dealing with—for example, if you have a claim of sexual harassment, you should contact a women’s group. Inquire as to who their attorneys were and what they thought of them. If you talk to a half-dozen folks who have had a similar legal issue, you’re likely to get many useful leads.

However, don’t choose a lawyer purely on the basis of someone else’s suggestion. Different people will react to a lawyer’s approach and personality in different ways. After you’ve met with the lawyer, discussed your case, and decided that you’re comfortable working together, hire him or her.

Furthermore, obtaining a lawyer with the knowledge you want through a personal reference may be difficult. For example, if your buddy recommended a wonderful divorce lawyer but you require incorporation counsel, the recommendation will be useless. Don’t give up right away, though. Consider phoning the divorce attorney and stating that they come highly recommended, as well as asking if the firm utilizes a certain business attorney. You could discover the ideal match.

Businesses that provide services to major players in the legal field you’re interested in may be able to assist you in finding attorneys to consider. If you need help with small business legislation, for example, contact your accountant, insurance agency, or real estate broker. Because they deal with business attorneys on a daily basis, these experts may make educated judgments about them.

Pay special attention to the relationship between you and your attorney. You may never create an ideal lawyer-client connection if you are uncomfortable with that individual during your first encounter or two, no matter how experienced or well-recommended that lawyer is.

Trust your intuition and look for an attorney that shares your personality. Experience, personal rapport, and accessibility should all be considered.

You want a lawyer that will work hard on your behalf and complete all duties on time. Inquire about how to contact prospective lawyers and how long it will take them to respond to your messages.

Even if the lawyer is easy to talk to and appears kind, don’t skip this step. Many busy lawyers have workflow procedures in place, and they’ll appreciate it if you follow them.

Hong Kong “General Practioner” Lawyers

Keep in mind that a “general practitioner” who operates in a variety of legal fields may not be knowledgeable enough about your specific issue to be helpful. For example, in Hong Kong, only around 1,000 lawyers have adequate knowledge and expertise in small business law to be of genuine assistance to a budding entrepreneur.

Working with an attorney who is familiar with the sector, such as employment discrimination, zoning rules, software design concerns, or restaurant licensing, can be beneficial. You might take advantage of the fact that the lawyer is already well-versed in the subject. Although an expert may charge a bit extra, it is frequently money well spent.

In Summary

There are several methods for locating a trustworthy attorney. A referral from a trustworthy friend, family, or business acquaintance is one of the finest. However, keep in mind that each legal matter is unique, and a lawyer who is great for someone else may not be ideal for you or your legal issue.

Yes, advertisements are beneficial in certain respects, but always be wary of accepting everything you read and hear, and this is especially true with commercials. Newspaper, telephone directory, radio, television, and Internet advertisements, as well as direct mail, can help you learn the names of attorneys who could be suitable for your legal needs. Some advertisements will also assist you in determining a lawyer’s area of specialization. Other advertisements will list a cost or a range of fees for processing a certain sort of “simple” case. Keep in mind that your situation might not have a straightforward answer. If a lawyer offers a cost, be sure you understand exactly what services and expenditures the fee includes and excludes.

Legal services, like many other items, are frequently cheaper when purchased in bulk. Some businesses, labor unions, and other organizations have developed “legal insurance” programs. These plans differ. In routine legal situations, many cover the majority, if not all, of the costs of legal consultations, document preparation, and court representation. Other programs merely include legal advice and consultation.

Pay sure you understand a legal plan’s coverage and if you’ll be forced to make out-of-pocket contributions before enrolling. These programs are structured similarly to group or cooperative medical insurance policies. Employers or unions establish a fund to cover employee legal bills, with the employee making a small co-payment in some cases. In recent years, legal group plans have grown significantly more common. Customers may get such programs from several department stores and credit card firms.

Finding the best lawyer for you may be daunting, but it doesn’t have to be if you know what questions to ask.

Although hiring an attorney isn’t always essential when dealing with legal issues, if you’ve made the decision to do so, you may be asking how to locate a decent one. Before you start looking for a lawyer, keep in mind that there are several sorts of attorneys, ranging from estate planning to criminal defense. Concentrate your search on attorneys who specialize in the area of law for which you want legal assistance.

Ask your family, friends, coworkers, and acquaintances whether they know of any attorneys who may be recommended. Personal references are some of the most trustworthy references available.

Finally, and probably most importantly, when picking a lawyer, trust your instincts. You must feel completely at ease with the person who will represent you and your interests, especially because you will likely be disclosing personal information and perhaps entrusting your future to him or her.

In terms of physical security, a locksmith’s job often entails determining the amount of danger to an individual or organization, then suggesting and implementing suitable equipment and procedures to establish “security layers” that outperform the reasonable gain to an intruder or attacker. Hong Kong Swimming Pool Maintenance Guide

Owning a swimming pool in the bustling metropolis of Hong Kong provides a calm getaway from the city’s hustle and bustle.

However, persistent maintenance is required to keep this paradise in top condition against Hong Kong’s distinctive climate and urban difficulties.

These swimming pool care instructions will ensure that Hong Kong residents enjoy their pools all year.

Dive in, and by the end, you’ll have the expertise to keep your pool in beautiful shape even in the middle of the city.

Article Summary:

What Are the Basic Components of a Hong Kong Swimming Pool?

Every swimming pool in Hong Kong has various vital components that must be maintained on a regular basis. Understanding key components, such as the pool pump, pool filter, and pool liner, ensures appropriate care specific to Hong Kong pools, given the city’s particular environment.

2. Why is Regular Pool Maintenance Required in Hong Kong?

The humid and tropical climate of Hong Kong can make pool maintenance difficult. Regular maintenance not only keeps your pool clean, but it also keeps the pool water safe for swimming and combats the region’s special environmental conditions.

3. How Frequently Should You Clean Your Hong Kong Pool?

Given the city’s dust and poor air quality, Hong Kong pools may need to be cleaned more frequently. Checking the pool water chemistry should be done once a week, while vacuuming should be done twice a week, especially during the humid months.

4. What Is the Role of the Pool Filter and How Do You Maintain It in Hong Kong?

Pool filters are considerably more important in Hong Kong’s metropolitan environment. They contribute to pool water clarity by eliminating urban toxins and detritus. Regular cleaning of the filter ensures its efficacy in the face of the city’s particular challenges.

5. How to Vacuum Your Pool and Why It’s Important in Hong Kong

Given the metropolis, vacuuming the pool effectively removes city-related detritus. In Hong Kong, using an automatic pool cleaner or a pool vacuum is extremely important for maintaining a clean and pleasant pool surface.

6. What is the best pool water testing schedule for Hong Kong pools?

Water testing on a regular basis is required to balance the particular contaminants and environmental elements found in Hong Kong. Check pH levels, chlorine levels, and other important factors matched to the city’s environment on a regular basis with a test kit.

7. How to Maintain a Healthy Chlorine Level in Your Hong Kong Swimming Pool

With Hong Kong’s crowded population and urban environs, keeping the proper chlorine levels in your pool guarantees that it remains free of hazardous bacteria, making it safe for everyone.

8. What Makes a Pool Cover a Must-Have in Hong Kong?

A pool cover is needed in Hong Kong because of the unpredictable rain showers and urban detritus. It aids in regulating water temperature, especially during cooler months, by reducing evaporation and keeping out city-related trash.

9. Is a Weekly or Monthly Pool Maintenance Schedule Required in Hong Kong?

A specialized maintenance program is critical given the city’s particular problems. Weekly chores in Hong Kong could include testing chemical balance, whereas monthly tasks could include more thorough cleaning or equipment inspection.

10. What Should You Do If You Have Pool Issues in Hong Kong?

Pools in Hong Kong might cause problems due to the city’s unique atmosphere and characteristics. Knowing when to engage a Hong Kong-based pool professional is critical, from hazy pool water due to urban contaminants to equipment issues.

Main Takeaways:

  • Hong Kong pools include unusual components that necessitate specific upkeep.
  • Regular maintenance adapted to the climate of Hong Kong ensures pool longevity and safety.
  • Given the city’s ecology, vacuuming and testing are extremely important.
  • Pool covers provide protection from the urban problems of Hong Kong.
  • Consult a Hong Kong pool professional for city-specific concerns and routine maintenance.

Maintaining a swimming pool in Hong Kong may appear difficult, but with the proper knowledge and routine customized to the city’s specific environment, it can be a pleasant undertaking. With these recommendations, you can dive into clean, transparent, and safe waters even in the midst of the city. In Hong Kong, have fun swimming!
